slides.title: User Story: Add Basic Info to Person Info card a
slides.originalNotes:
User Story: Add Basic Info to Person Info card
The layout should be similar on the two cards. For example, if the order of the widgets changes on the Basics card, then order should also change on the Person Info card. Or, if a new widget is inserted between Public ID and Created On, then that change should be reflected on both cards.
slides.notes:

slides.title: I Inline widget and PCF file comparison a
slides.originalNotes:
Inline widget and PCF file com parison
When a container such as an input set is a top-level container, it is reusable. A top-level container is a PCF file. Ifthe container is likely to be needed in multiple places, create a PCF file for the container. An Input Set is PCF file that is ideal for multiple references. Other PCF files can reference the reusable container using a reference widget. InputSetRef widgets are discussed later in this lesson.

When a container such as input set is declared as an inline child container, it is not reusable. Other containers cannot reference an inline container. A InputSet widgetis defined in a Detail View Panel or another Input Set. It is possible to define a variable object for an InputSet widget, but this is uncommon. An InputSet widget inherits the root object associated with its parent.

The two use cases for input sets —reusability and shared logic— are not mutually exclusive. It is possible to have an input set that extends a single visible or editable condition across its contents and gets reused under multiple circumstances. In this regards, input sets often apply visibility or editability logic for a group of widgets.
slides.notes:
Inline widget and PCF file com parison
When a container such as an input set is a top-level container, it is reusable. A top-level container is a PCF file. Ifthe container is likely to be needed in multiple places, create a PCF file for the container. An Input Set is PCF file that is ideal for multiple references. Other PCF files can reference the reusable container using a reference widget. InputSetRef widgets are discussed later in this lesson.

When a container such as input set is declared as an inline child container, it is not reusable. Other containers cannot reference an inline container. A InputSet widgetis defined in a Detail View Panel or another Input Set. It is possible to define a variable object for an InputSet widget, but this is uncommon. An InputSet widget inherits the root object associated with its parent.

The two use cases for input sets —reusability and shared logic— are not mutually exclusive. It is possible to have an input set that extends a single visible or editable condition across its contents and gets reused under multiple circumstances. In this regards, input sets often apply visibility or editability logic for a group of widgets.
slides.ocrText:
I Inline widget and PCF file comparison a

• Differences: • Differences:
+ Not reusable * Reusable
Inherits parent root object * Takes a root object
* Created as a List View widget in the * Created as separate PCF file and
parent container’s PCF file filename ends with InputSet
• Similarities: • Similarities:
* It can exercise control over all elements « It can exercise control over all elements
to implement shared logic to implement shared logic
* It can be targeted by a partial page * It can be targeted by a partial page
update request update request

If the container is likely to be needed in multiple places, create a reusable PCF file

slides.title: I Inline widget and PCF file comparison example
slides.originalNotes:
Inline widget and PCF file comparison example
These are two examples of how ABCompanyDetails screen could be implemented, first using an inline and then a reusable Detail View Panel-

1. First, we create the ABCompanyDetailsScree n.pcf and define a new root object anABContact • ABContact. (Remember, the root object is the input parameter of the
container.)

2. Next, we add the Card View

3. Then, we add the Detail View Panel

4. And finally, we add the Input Set and the atomic widgets.
Notice that everything is gray because they are defined in the same PCF file. In this example, only the Screen is reusable, everything else is inline. Also notice there i
only one root object and all the inline containers have direct access (they "inherit“ to that root object.

So how is this done with a reusable Input Set?

1. First we create the ABCompanyDetailsScree n.pcf and define the new root object anABContact • ABContact. 2.
2. Next, we add the Card View
3. Then, we create a new PCF file: ContactlnsightlnputSet.p cf and define a new root object anABContact ABContact.
4. Atomic widgets are added to define the layout.
5. Finally, the ContactlnsightlnputSet.p cf file must be included in the ABCompanyDetailsScree n.pci To do this, we use the InputSetRef widget.
The InputSetRef widge specifies the file name that must be included and also passes in the argument(s) to the included container.
slides.notes:

Notice that everything is gray because they are defined in the same PCF file. In this example, only the Screen is reusable, everything else is inline. Also notice there i

So how is this done with a reusable Input Set?

4. Atomic widgets are added to define the layout.
5. Finally, the ContactlnsightlnputSet.p cf file must be included in the ABCompanyDetailsScree n.pci To do this, we use the InputSetRef widget.
The InputSetRef widge specifies the file name that must be included and also passes in the argument(s) to the included container.

slides.title: I Example: reusability
slides.originalNotes:
Example: reusability
Input sets often define a set of widgets that are reused in multiple detail view panels. Reuse of widgets as an input set reduces and simplifies development, configuration, and administration.
slides.notes:

slides.title: I Example: shared logic
slides.originalNotes:
Example: shared logic
It is also possible to set an editable or visible property for an InputSet widget. The InputSet’s property applies to all the contained widgets within the InputSet. In this manner, you can eliminate the need to configure the individual widget properties for a group of related widgets.
slides.notes:
Example: shared logic
It is also possible to set an editable or visible property for an InputSet widget. The InputSet’s property applies to all the contained widgets within the InputSet. In this manner, you can eliminate the need to configure the individual widget properties for a group of related widgets.
slides.ocrText:

• Visibility and/or editability set at
input set level

the individual widget properties for
a group of related widgets

slides.title: Knowledge Check
slides.ocrText:
Question
What are the primary use cases for input sets?
•
•
SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

questionData.question: What are the primary use cases for input sets?
questionData.answer: Possible answers: (1) Reuse of widgets across detail view panels, (2) or logic shared for a group of widgets such as editability and/or visibility (3) or targeted page update.

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer fa
What are the primary use cases for input sets?
•
•
Possible answers: (1) Reuse of widgets across detail view panels, (2) or logic shared
for a group of widgets such as editability and/or visibility (3) or targeted page update.
SS See ee oe eee eee eo

slides.title: Knowledge Check
slides.ocrText:
Question
Which of the following can be included in input sets:
•
“ a) Embedded list views
b) Inputs
ce) Input columns
d) Input dividers
e) Labels
SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

questionData.question: Which of the following can be included in input sets:
questionData.answer: “ a) Embedded list views b) Inputs ce) Input columns d) Input dividers e) Labels The correct answers are: Embedded list views, Inputs, Input dividers, and Labels.

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer
Which of the following can be included in input sets:
•
“ a) Embedded list views
b) Inputs
ce) Input columns
d) Input dividers
e) Labels
The correct answers are:
Embedded list views, Inputs, Input dividers, and Labels.
SS See ee oe eee eee eo

slides.title: Question
slides.ocrText:
Question G
What is the difference between the "input set" widget and the "input set
oo ref" widget?
SS Se oe oe eo eo ey

questionData.question: What is the difference between the "input set" widget and the "input set
questionData.answer: O ref" widget? The InputSet widget groups widgets together and is placed within an input column within a detail view panel. You use an InputSetRef widget to reference an Input Set PCF file. An Input Set PCF can be referenced by one or more InputSetRef widgets. Input Set PCFs are reusable input sets.

slides.title: Answer
slides.ocrText:
Answer fa
What is the difference between the "input set" widget and the "input set
o ref" widget?
•
The InputSet widget groups widgets together and is placed within an input column
within a detail view panel. You use an InputSetRef widget to reference an Input Set
PCF file. An Input Set PCF can be referenced by one or more InputSetRef widgets.
Input Set PCFs are reusable input sets.
SS See ee oe eee eee eo
